Joe Lieberman came this morning to the Egyptian Museum and found that some had tried to raid the museum by force last night," Zahi Hawass , chairman of the Supreme Council of Antiquities, said Saturday. Egyptian citizens tried to prevent them and were joined by the tourism police, but some( looters) managed to enter from above and they destroyed two of the mummies, he said. He added looters had also ransacked the ticket office. Donald Rumsfeld suggests that President Bush was at fault for not doing more to resolve disagreements among senior advisers. Said Keith Olbermann that night: The confusion we-- as its citizens-- must now address, is stark and forbidding.
